comments:
I received this stack from a user, always getting a crash on exit:

java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 8
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Menu.releaseWidget(Menu.java:787)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget.dispose(Widget.java:489)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Decorations.releaseWidget(Decorations.java:345)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Shell.releaseWidget(Shell.java:1117)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget.dispose(Widget.java:489)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.release(Display.java:2663)
	at org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Device.dispose(Device.java:159)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.close(Display.java:789)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.commandProc(Display.java:672)
	at org.eclipse.swt.internal.carbon.OS.MenuSelect(Native Method)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.mouseProc(Display.java:2491)
	at org.eclipse.swt.internal.carbon.OS.SendEventToEventTarget(Native Method)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.readAndDispatch(Display.java:2585)
	at net.sourceforge.rssowl.controller.GUI.runEventLoop(Unknown Source)
	at net.sourceforge.rssowl.controller.GUI.showGui(Unknown Source)
	at net.sourceforge.rssowl.controller.RSSOwlLoader$1.run(Unknown Source)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.RunnableLock.run(RunnableLock.java:35)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Synchronizer.runAsyncMessages(Synchronizer.java:118)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.runAsyncMessages(Display.java:2830)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.readAndDispatch(Display.java:2611)
	at net.sourceforge.rssowl.controller.RSSOwlLoader.<init>(Unknown Source)
	at net.sourceforge.rssowl.controller.RSSOwlLoader.main(Unknown Source)

He is using Apple's latest  X.3.8 with all the updates, including Java 142
Update2. G4, 1Ghz, 1GB RAM.

Any ideas?

Ben

Andre, can you confirm this crash?  I assume you are running or can run the 
latest and greatest from Apple?  Thanks.

No, I could't reproduce this bug with RSSOwl (and I haven't experienced anything similar with Eclipse).
Suggest to close.

Ben, I don't have any ideas and neither does Andre.  Can you send the user 
here for us to debug with him?

Sure I did. I also asked if this problem occurs running Eclipse on his Mac.

Ben

Ben,
I deleted the RSSOwl preference file, downloaded a fresh copy of v_1.1 and installed it, today.  I still get 
the crash on quit with a force-quit needed to stop the spinning ball.  I tried quitting the application 
from the menu bar, from the application and from the dock. I get the same result no matter how I quit 
the application.  I have sent the crash logs to you.
John

Is this also happening quitting Eclipse 3.1 M5a?

Ben

Ben,
I downloaded and installed Eclipse.  The recommended version for OS X was Eclipse SDK_3.0.2.  Eclipse 
shows the same type of behavior on quit. However, it does not need to be force-quit.  The messages I 
see the most in the error logs are: java.lang.NullPointerException and Unhandled event loop exception.
John

Regarding Eclipse 3.1 Milestone 5, it would be interesting to see what happens
on your Mac quitting it, since it uses kind of the same SWT version as RSSOwl does.

SWT version of Eclipse 3.0.2 was last used in RSSOwl 0.8b as far as I know.

Ben

Ok, the Log shows similiar stackstraces, find it attached.

And here is the crash log of him quitting Eclipse 3.1.

Can you reproduce this problem on
- a different account
- a different machine?

Even after running on a different account, the same crash is occuring. This is
really strange, since the exception is always

"java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 8"

no matter if Eclipse or RSSOwl.

Ben

Do you have apps like FruitMenu installed? Just wondering if extra menu items are added to the Eclipse/
RSSOwl menus?

I love FruitMenu, but I haven't seen it working with Eclipse for ages (see bug #41992).
But I have't had any Fruitmenu related crashes either.
Is this still a problem running the latest? I believe the changes for bug#106006 might have fixed this.
Please reopen if this is still a problem.
